intro: Pagetia monostylis, commonly known as the single-styled pagetia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a single style in its flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves are compound, with a broad, ovate shape and a slightly hairy surface. Pagetia monostylis is of interest to botanists due to its morphological distinctiveness and limited distribution.
